text:
In Apache version 1.3.33 mod_speling was able to rebuild an URL with spelling
errors in directories. Example:

http://www.test.com/MISSPell/test.php
was sucesfully mapped to:
http://www.test.com/misspell/test.php

Now we are testing Apache 2.2.0 and found that it is only able to search for
similar file names:

http://www.test.com/mispell/TEst.php
is sucesfully mapped to:
http://www.test.com/misspell/test.php

but

http://www.test.com/MISSPell/test.php

fails with 404.
creator: rui@shylex.com

text:
In Apache version 2.0.55 this is working correctly, but from version 2.2.0
mod_speling doesn't correct the names of folders.

Bjorn.Wiberg@uadm.uu.se
text: Have the exact same problem with Apache 2.2.3 on IBM AIX 5.2 and 5.3.

It should be noted that "AcceptPathInfo on" has side effects which are clearly
undesirable, and therefore it would be nice if this error would be corrected in
mod_speling (mod_speling requesting/granting path info information instead of
one having to enable it globally?).

For instance, when accessing directories such as /directory/ (no index page)
with mod_autoindex showing the directory listing one can happily append
/documentation/documentation/documentati... (etc.) to the URL and Apache will
serve the /documentation/ directory... Imagine a (broken) webpage with relative
links to "documentation/" and a URL crawler which descends deep and you'll get
the idea. It will continue appending "documentation/" to the list of URLs to
discover and digging deeper and deeper but never reach an end...

Best regards,
Björn
creator: Bjorn.Wiberg@uadm.uu.se
dhawke@micron.com
text:
Replicated on Sol10, Apache 2.2.4.

This bug also affects directories without a trailing filename, but with the 
trailing slash.  The bug is only replicatable when AcceptPathInfo is not set to 
On.

example:

http://foo/bar/ exists.

http://foo/baa will be corrected.
http://foo/baa/ will not.
This bug seems to be solved as of 2.2.9, see bug 43562
